description: Conversion of ground floor Class E to a 3-bed self-contained flat
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
REASON
To comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990
The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out except in complete accordance with the details shown on the submitted plan numbers:
CR/PLAN/001
CR/PLAN/002
CR/PLAN/003 Rev-A
CR/PLAN/004
CR/PLAN/006
and shall thereafter be retained/maintained for as long as the development remains in existence.
REASON
To ensure the development complies with the provisions of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 1 (2012), Part 2 (2020) and the London Plan (2021).

The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building, with the side windows facing south toward the car park timber framed, and shall thereafter be retained as such.
REASON

To safeguard the visual amenities of the area and to ensure that the proposed development does not have an adverse effect upon the appearance of the existing building in accordance with Policy DMHB 11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 (2020)

Notwithstanding the landscaping details shown on the approved plans, prior to occupation of the approved dwelling, a amended groundfloor plan shall be submitted to an approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority showing the installation of a 1.8m fence surrounding the garden of the proposed flat. The plan should also include a single electrical vehicle charging point to be used by the sites future vehicle users. Thereafter the fence and charging point shall be installed prior to occupation and maintained throughout the lifetime of the development.

REASON: To ensure privacy and a good standard of external living accommodation for the future residents of the approved flat in accordance with Policy DHMB 18 and paragraph 130 (f) of the NPPF (2021). To ensure that sustainable methods of transport are supported in compliance with policy T6 of the London Plan (2021).

The side window(s) facing the parking area to the south shall be glazed with permanently obscured glass to at least scale 4 on the Pilkington scale and be non-opening below a height of 1.8 metres taken from internal finished floor level for so long as the development remains in existence.
REASON
To prevent overlooking to adjoining properties in accordance with policy DMHB 11 of the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 2 (2020).

The decision to GRANT planning permission has been taken having regard to all relevant planning legislation, regulations, guidance, circulars and Council policies, including The Human Rights Act (1998) (HRA 1998) which makes it unlawful for the Council to act incompatibly with Convention rights, specifically Article 6 (right to a fair hearing); Article 8 (right to respect for private and family life); Article 1 of the First Protocol (protection of property) and Article 14 (prohibition of discrimination).

The decision to GRANT/REFUSE planning permission has been taken having regard to the policies and proposals in the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 1 (2012) and Part 2 (2020) set out below, including Supplementary Planning Guidance, and to all relevant material considerations, including The London Plan (2021) and national guidance.
Any changes to the front elevation and/or shop front would require planning permission. No external changes are proposed and/or approved as part of this application.
